podcastContent: 敦煌壁画常常画这张画，就是维摩诘和文殊的对话。但我自己喜欢这一部经，常常抄这一部经，所以我觉得里面的对话好精彩。因为文殊菩萨进来了，到了病房就问说，诶，你是一个修行的人，那修行的人怎么会生病呢？你不是应该修行的这个程度已经很高了，你应该到了不生病的状况。那维摩诘就回答说：从师有爱，则我病生八个字，我常常写这8个字送朋友，我们知道痴情的痴这个字，就是理应知道不应该做的事，可是我情不自禁，我还是会做，从痴有爱，那我们也觉得很有趣，菩萨到底应不应该有爱，如果有爱是不是也有恨。就我觉得他触碰到大乘佛学非常惊人的部分，就从痴有爱则我病生，所以我生病，那文殊菩萨就问他，那你什么时候病会好。他说一切众生病好，我的病也就好。这个时候我们忽然发现维摩诘讲的病，不是一般的病，是说他承担了所有众生之病，我们知道这是大乘佛学。我们有一天知道一个人的修行到一定的程度，那个不关心是因为他有更高的关心。他会看到所有在现实里的争吵之上，应该有一个更为亲明的东西。所以我们常读到无无明，对无明的一种堪悟，能够有更大的了悟的可能。这是为摩皆经一直要传达的。

analysis.contentEssence: 以“病”为愿力的容器：从个人痴爱之病，转为承载众生之病，并在更高层次的关心中得到堪悟。
analysis.physicalMetaphor: 一只点燃的灯芯被放入透明的琉璃罩内，罩壁慢慢凝出雾气与水珠；灯并不熄灭，而是把雾气的重量“留在自己身上”，直到罩内重新澄明。
analysis.metaphorVisualization: 中心是一枚小而稳定的发光点（灯芯），外层是一圈半透明的壳（琉璃罩）；壳内壁有不规则凝结颗粒由密到疏，象征“从痴有爱则我病生”的聚集与承担，最终向澄清过渡（颗粒减少但不完全消失）。

tension.from: “修行人为何会病”的表面矛盾与痴爱牵缠
tension.to: 把病转义为承载众生之病的愿力与更大了悟

topologicalLayout.zoneCountReason: 意象是“灯在琉璃罩内承受凝露”，主体与承载空间属于同一场域，不需要分成多个对立区域。
topologicalLayout.divisionMethodReason: 灯芯为中心，病/雾/露在罩壁环形分布，天然是向心—环绕结构。

primaryRelationship.typeReason: 维摩诘之“病”像琉璃罩：把众生之病/雾气包纳在自身边界内，中心保持觉照之灯不灭。

rhythmSignature.typeReason: 凝结颗粒从密集到稀疏，象征从情执聚集的“病相”逐渐被堪悟与愿力安放、澄清。

structureParams.tensionExpression: 用“稳定光点”对“罩壁凝露的重量与密度变化”制造张力：中心不动、外层承载；颗粒密度递减呈现从痴爱之病到承担众生之病再趋澄明的转义过程。

antiTemplateCheck.howIsThisDifferent: 采用“中心灯芯—外层琉璃罩凝露”的嵌套承载结构与密度递变节奏，表达承担与堪悟；没有把概念拆成并列对照区，而是让意义在同一容器中发生转义与澄清。

prompt:
[CANVAS]
- Format: 1:1 square, 1024x1024 pixels
- Safe margin: 10% padding on all sides
- Whitespace target: 65% (large calm negative space, Ma)
- Visual weight distribution: single-field composition with a small, steady warm core near center; most visual weight is a faint radial container boundary and sparse condensation along its inner edge

[TOPOLOGY] — based on topologicalLayout
- Zone count: 1 (no split panels, no opposing fields)
- Division method: radial (center-to-edge organization)
- Zone ratios: 100
- Physical metaphor visualization: depict one unified atmosphere: a lit wick at the center inside a transparent liuli glass罩; condensation forms as a ring-like phenomenon on the inner wall, maintaining a clear central cavity

[RELATIONSHIPS] — based on primaryRelationship
- Primary relationship type: nested
- Interaction quality: touching
- Spatial expression: three nested presences: (1) central wick/flame mark; (2) an enclosing glass罩 boundary that lightly “touches” the condensation; (3) condensation clusters attached to the inner rim of the罩, not floating freely

[RHYTHM] — based on rhythmSignature
- Rhythm type: decelerating
- Element count: 4
- Interval/size variation: four condensation clusters along the inner wall; start with the densest cluster (tightest droplets) on one arc, then progressively thinner/sparser clusters as they proceed around the ring, creating a clearing trajectory while keeping the center perfectly still

[GEOMETRY]
- Primary shape: a thin, rounded oval/teardrop wick mark centered (or slightly above center), small (about 6–8% of canvas height), soft edges
- Secondary shapes: (1) one large, very thin circular/oval罩 outline (about 55–65% of canvas width), centered; (2) four small droplet/mist clusters hugging the inner rim of the罩 (each cluster 2–4% of canvas area, but total accent area must stay within constraints below)
- Lines: maximum 2 lines total: use one ultra-thin outline line for the罩 boundary; optionally one hairline vertical hint for the wick stem (keep extremely subtle)
- Edge treatment: soft-division edges, gentle feathering on mist; keep boundaries crisp enough to feel “seen-through” yet not harsh
- Negative space: keep the majority of the field empty and breathable; no framing boxes; no diagonals

[COLOR]
- Background: cool-mist #F5F7FA (flat, paper-like)
- Primary hue: butter #FFF8E1 for the wick/flame and the faint warm aura; keep lightness ~96%, saturation low
- Secondary hue (accent): eucalyptus #E0F2F1 used sparingly as cool condensation tint
- Temperature: overall cool, lucid atmosphere with a quiet warm core (warm-cool contrast)
- Contrast method: temperature contrast only (warm center against cool field) while maintaining very high value; no hard black
- Accent usage: eucalyptus must be ~3% of total image area, applied as a thin translucent veil on parts of the condensation clusters; opacity exactly ~14% (10–15% acceptable range)

[LIGHTING]
- Light source: subtle internal glow from the wick
- Glow effects: 1 glow only—very small, soft halo around the wick in butter (#FFF8E1), extremely restrained
- Ambient atmosphere: bright, high-key clarity; no dramatic shadows

[TEXTURE & MATERIAL] — degree micro-adjustments only
- Surface quality: matte, fine paper grain background; glass罩 appears as a faint translucent boundary with minimal highlights
- Edge sharpness: soft on mist and droplets; slightly clearer on the罩 outline to imply insight/clarity without splitting the composition
- Transparency: gentle translucency on condensation; keep all tones within high lightness (minimum brightness 85%), max saturation 32%

[ATMOSPHERE & MOOD]
- Japanese aesthetic: Ma (breathing room), Kanso (few elements), Shibui (quiet restraint)
- Content resonance: compassionate burden held by the boundary (condensation) while inner light remains unwavering; the decelerating rhythm signifies easing/clearing

[STYLE]
- Render style: clean vector-like digital art, flat + subtle transparency; no photorealism, no 3D rendering
- No text, no symbols, no UI elements
- Ensure high clarity at 128px thumbnail: the warm wick should read immediately, the glass ring should be barely-there but legible, and the four condensation clusters should show the decelerating density clearly.
